Name: m.aibin
AboutMe: I completed my Bachelors Degree in Computer Sciences at Wroclaw University of Technology in February 2012, and then I finished my Masters Degree in Computer Science at the same university. Currently, I am a third year PhD student at Wroclaw University of Technology with a focus on optimization of algorithms used in networks and computer programs (remote program). During my PhD studies I presented papers at international IEEE conferences on the subject of optimization of Elastic Optical and Software Defined Networks. Moreover, in March of 2015 I was invited to Simon Fraser University to present a speech on my current research topics. I have 5 years of experience in the industry. I started as an apprentice in a very large polish company Nasza Klasa and after two months of practice I was invited to a 4-month contract for the position of a project manager. Then, I worked for a year as an IT Administrator at the Wroc≈Çaw University of Technology. For more than two years I have been involved in professional Java software development. During my studies I began my education of web development, and I received a position at Human-Device as a software developer. Currently I uphold a standing as a CTO in a small Polish start-up company. In addition to the software development positions, I had three faculty contracts, two of which where at a public university, and one at a private educational institution. I led Programming Methodology classes (in Java language), SQL Databases classes (MySQL, Oracle and DB2) and CISCO networking laboratories. My responsibilities included: creating syllabus, preparing teaching material, creating assignments and handouts, conducting evaluation and preparing final exams.
